name: Additive bradycardia risk with multiple HR-lowering drugs
actions: Avoid combining multiple HR-lowering drugs when feasible (educational).
Monitor heart rate, blood pressure, dizziness, syncope symptoms.
Use extra caution with conduction disease or baseline bradycardia.

rationale: Combined effects can increase symptomatic bradycardia risk.

explanation_template: {A_name} and {B_name} both have HR-lowering (bradycardia) effects. Using them together can increase bradycardia-related risk.

references.citation: PD stacking: additive HR-lowering effects can increase symptomatic bradycardia risk.
